thread.title: Jade Bring ‘Master Terminal’ to Abu Dhabi
thread.title_full: Jade Bring ‘Master Terminal’ to Abu Dhabi

author: porttechnology.org
title: Jade Bring ‘Master Terminal’ to Abu Dhabi
text:
Jade Software has announced that its Master Terminal is now live at three of seven planned installations for Abu Dhabi Ports (ADP) as part of the contract awarded to replace its Legacy System with Jade’s terminal operating system. The recent implementation at Musaffah Port makes that the third ADP port to go live with the new technology.
Zayed Port went live first on July 1, 2015 after a six month implementation phase, a record for a general cargo terminal the size of Zayed Port.
The configuration and training delivered at Zayed Port laid the foundation for the speedy delivery of the next two projects; Khalifa Port going live on August 1 and Musaffah Port following soon after on September 16, 2015.  
Read a Technical Paper on Khalifa Port 
David Lindsay, Managing Director of Jade Software, said: “Jade is fast being recognised as the leading terminal operating system for mixed cargo ports where increased operational efficiencies are key, helped greatly by its proven implementation methodology and expert implementation team.
“Jade has also invested heavily in additional implementation and business support around the globe to cope with the increased demand for Master Terminal.”
For Abu Dhabi Ports, Jade’s implementation team worked closely with port staff to ensure that the new processes and technology were seamlessly integrated into their business and all their staff had been expertly trained.  
Review Jade in the PTI Supplier Directory
